titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Open University Records
titlestmt.author: Saadia Mohamed, Toshia Miracle, Stephanie Malone, Karen Jordan, Mikaela Selley and Bobby Marlin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoded in EAD by Archon 3.21 from an SQL database source on November 7th, 2016.

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Open University Records 1970/1979

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: These records are contained in 18 record cartons. The materials relate to the Open University program and include correspondence, reports, program information, workbooks and classroom supplements.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information -
bioghist.p: In 1969, The University of Houston was one of four universities in the United States to utilize this new concept in education. The purpose of the “Open University” program was to provide better university education for large groups of students through successful self-study programs which covered the relationships between the sciences and society and the arts and society. Through the use of a wide range of multi-media material, including closed circuit television and radio programs and self-study texts, students were able to learn on their own without being required to spend numerous hours in the classroom.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use -
userestrict.p: The material in this collection is in the public domain. However, Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, and all reproduction restrictions apply although, copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Open University Records. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records are contained in 18 record cartons. The materials relate to the Open University program and include correspondence, reports, program information, workbooks and classroom supplements. The collection is organized in 3 series; Administrative Files, Classroom Materials, Audio/Video Tapes. Each series is arranged alphabetically by subject title. Materials range in year from 1970 to 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes 4 boxes of administrative material, ranging from 1970 to 1979. It includes articles, correspondence, budget and finance material, and grade sheets. This series includes reference material from the British Open University Program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes 9 record cartons of classroom materials arranged by one of the following subject titles; Art, Education, Math, Science and Technology. Course guides, teacher’s guides, and textbooks will be found. The bulk of this series is classroom workbooks, also called unit books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes 5 boxes of audio and video teaching aids meant to be used both inside and outside the classroom. The audio tapes include cassettes and records for Art, Social Science, and Math/ Technology classes. There are 25 video tapes organized by title, which include The Age of Revolution, The Third Testament, and Humanities. This series also includes one promotional video done by the BBC.
